page.title: 05FARMING IN DUNLOP
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMERS ARE DAIRY FARMERS BUT SOME FARMERS FARM BEEF CATTLE OR SHEEP.THE DAIRY CATTLE THAT ARE USED AROUND DUNLOP ARE FRIESIANS AND SOME AYRSHIRES.THE BEEF CATTLE ARE FRIESIAN BULLOCKS,HEREFORDS AND HEREFORD CROSSES.THERE ARE NO ARABLE FARMERS AND MOST FIELDS THAT ARE PLOUGHED HAVE BEEN PLOUGHED FOR RESEEDING.THE LAND THAT IS NOT USED FOR CATTLE IS USED FOR SILAGE AND HAY.THERE ARE NORMALLY TWO CUTS FROM A FIELD.THE FIRST CUT IN MAY OR JUNE IS NORMALLY USED FOR SILAGE AND THE SECOND CUT IN JULY, AUGUST AND SEPTEMBER IS USED EITHER FOR SILAGE OR HAY.THERE ARE NO PIG FARMERS IN DUNLOPS AREA BUT SOME FARMERS KEEP ONE OR TWO PIGS.THE NEAREST MARKET IS IN KILMARNOCK WHICH IS OWNED BY A. AND J. WILSON WHO ALSO OWN PAISLEY MARKET.
